    (function(w,d,t) {

        }

        cc();
    })(window,document,'script');

<script>
    (function () {
        if ( typeof window.CustomEvent === "function" ) return false;
        function CustomEvent ( event, params ) {
            params = params || { bubbles: false, cancelable: false, detail: null };
            var evt = document.createEvent( 'CustomEvent' );
            evt.initCustomEvent( event, params.bubbles, params.cancelable, params.detail );
            return evt;
        }

        CustomEvent.prototype = window.Event.prototype;

        window.CustomEvent = CustomEvent;
    })();
</script>



    
    <script class="js-entry">
        if (window.config.mustardcut) {
            (function(w, d) {
                
                
                
                    window.Component = {};
                    window.suppressShareButton = true;
                

                var currentScript = d.currentScript || d.head.querySelector('script.js-entry');

                
                function catchNoModuleSupport() {
                    var scriptEl = d.createElement('script');
                    return (!('noModule' in scriptEl) && 'onbeforeload' in scriptEl)
                }

                var headScripts = [
                    {'src': '/oscar-static/js/polyfill-es5-bundle-1065715604.js', 'async': false},
                    {'src': '/oscar-static/js/airbrake-es5-bundle-067445f0ca.js', 'async': false},
                ];

                var bodyScripts = [
                    {'src': '/oscar-static/js/app-es5-bundle-f29c802dbd.js', 'async': false, 'module': false},
                    {'src': '/oscar-static/js/app-es6-bundle-b75c02ebea.js', 'async': false, 'module': true}
                    
                    
                        , {'src': '/oscar-static/js/global-article-es5-bundle-a105b18b5c.js', 'async': false, 'module': false},
                        {'src': '/oscar-static/js/global-article-es6-bundle-3e684c1164.js', 'async': false, 'module': true}
                    
                ];

                function createScript(script) {
                    var scriptEl = d.createElement('script');
                    scriptEl.src = script.src;
                    scriptEl.async = script.async;
                    if (script.module === true) {
                        scriptEl.type = "module";
                        if (catchNoModuleSupport()) {
                            scriptEl.src = '';
                        }
                    } else if (script.module === false) {
                        scriptEl.setAttribute('nomodule', true)
                    }
                    if (script.charset) {
                        scriptEl.setAttribute('charset', script.charset);
                    }

                    return scriptEl;
                }

                for (var i = 0; i < headScripts.length; ++i) {
                    var scriptEl = createScript(headScripts[i]);
                    currentScript.parentNode.insertBefore(scriptEl, currentScript.nextSibling);
                }

                d.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function() {
                    for (var i = 0; i < bodyScripts.length; ++i) {
                        var scriptEl = createScript(bodyScripts[i]);
                        d.body.appendChild(scriptEl);
                    }
                });

                // Webfont repeat view
                var config = w.config;
                if (config && config.publisherBrand && sessionStorage.fontsLoaded === 'true') {
                    d.documentElement.className += ' webfonts-loaded';
                }
            })(window, document);
        }
    </script>

        </div>
    

    
        <div data-component="data-unique-selling-points">
            <ul class="c-book-evaluation-divider u-list-reset c-book-show-more-less c-book-show-more-less--collapsed" data-test="unique-selling-points">
                
                    <li class="u-mb-8"><p>Describes recent advances in the use of fuzzy logic for the design of hybrid intelligent systems based on nature-inspired optimization and their applications in diverse areas</p></li>
                
                    <li class="u-mb-8"><p>Addresses areas such as intelligent control and robotics, pattern recognition, medical diagnosis, time series prediction and optimization of complex problems</p></li>
                
                    <li class="u-mb-8"><p>Based on papers presented at the North American Fuzzy Information Processing Society Annual Conference (NAFIPS 2017) held from 16 to 18 October 2017 in Cancun, Mexico</p></li>
                
                    <li class="u-mb-8"><p>Highlights recent research on Fuzzy Logic in Intelligent System Design</p></li>
                
            </ul>
        </div>
    

                    
    
        <div class="c-book-evaluation-divider">
            <p class="u-mb-8" data-test="series-link"><span class="u-text-bold">Part of the book series:</span> <a href="https://www.springer.com/series/11156" data-track="click" data-track-action="open book series" data-track-label="link">Advances in Intelligent Systems and Computing</a> (AISC, volume 648)</p>
            
        
    
    
        
            <p class="u-mb-8" data-test="conference-series-link"><span class="u-text-bold">Conference series link(s):</span>
            
                <a href="https://link.springer.com/conference/nafips" data-test="conference-series-link" data-track="click" data-track-action="open conference" data-track-label="link">NAFIPS: North American Fuzzy Information Processing Society Annual Conference</a>
            
            </p>
        </div>
    

                    <div class="c-book-evaluation-divider" data-test="article-metrics">

                    font-weight: bold;
                    color: #004b83;
                }

            </style>
 <script>
                ;(function () {
                    var timestamp = Date.now()
                    document.write('<div data-id="id_'+ timestamp +'"></div>')

                    var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0]
                    var script = document.createElement("script")
                    script.type = "text/javascript"
                    script.src = "https://buy.springer.com/assets/js/buybox-bundle-abe5f44a67.js"
                    script.id = "ecommerce-scripts-" + timestamp
                    head.appendChild(script)

                    var buybox = document.querySelector("[data-id=id_"+ timestamp +"]").parentNode

                    var now = new Date().getTime()
                    var start = 1650956400000
                    var   end = 1652338800000
                    var isMeasuringTime = now > start && now < end
                    
                    var campaignPricesMetricsGroup = initMetrics(start, end)

                    var campaignPricesActive = campaignPricesMetricsGroup === "B"

                    if (campaignPricesActive) {
                        revealCampaignPriceVersion()
                    }

                    var priceNS = campaignPricesActive ? ".buying-option-price-campaign " : ""

                    ;[].slice.call(buybox.querySelectorAll(".buying-option")).forEach(initCollapsibles)
                    ;[].slice.call(buybox.querySelectorAll(".buying-option")).forEach(addMetrics)
                    
                    if (document.cookie.indexOf("preOrderEnabled=true") > -1) {
                        ;[].slice.call(buybox.querySelectorAll(".buying-option button[type=submit]")).forEach(function (button, index) {
                            button.removeAttribute("disabled")
                        })
                        ;[].slice.call(buybox.querySelectorAll(".buying-option-pre-order-info")).forEach(function (el, index) {
                            el.style.display = 'none'
                        })
                        ;[].slice.call(buybox.querySelectorAll(".buying-option-pre-order-info.new-feature")).forEach(function (el, index) {
                            el.style.display = ''
                        })
                    }

                    function initMetrics(start, end) {
                        var metricsKey = "abMetricsCampaignPrices-v1"
                        var campaignPricesMetricsGroup = "X"
                        
                        if (!window.localStorage || !window.fetch) return campaignPricesMetricsGroup

                        if (!isMeasuringTime) {
                            window.localStorage.removeItem(metricsKey)
                            return "NONE"
                        }

                        try {
                            var metricsValue = window.localStorage.getItem(metricsKey)
                            campaignPricesMetricsGroup = metricsValue || randomDistribution(metricsKey)
                        } catch (err) {
                            console.log(err)
                        }

                        return campaignPricesMetricsGroup
                    }

                    function randomDistribution(metricsKey) {
                        var randomGroup = Math.random() < 0.5 ? "A" : "B"
                        window.localStorage.setItem(metricsKey, randomGroup)
                        return randomGroup
                    }

                    function revealCampaignPriceVersion() {
                        buybox.querySelector(".c-box").classList.add("campaign-prices")
                        buybox.querySelectorAll(".buying-option-price-campaign").forEach(function (campaignPrice) {
                            campaignPrice.removeAttribute("style")
                        })
                    }

                    function initCollapsibles(buyingOption, index) {
                        var toggle = buyingOption.querySelector(priceNS + ".buying-option-price")
                        buyingOption.classList.remove("expanded")
                        var form = buyingOption.querySelector(".buying-option-form")
                        
                        if (form) {
                            var formAction = form.getAttribute("action")
                            document.querySelector("#ecommerce-scripts-" + timestamp).addEventListener("load", bindModal(form, formAction, timestamp, index), false)
                        }
                        
                        var priceInfo = buyingOption.querySelector(priceNS + ".price-info")

                        if (toggle && form && priceInfo) {
                            toggle.setAttribute("role", "button")
                            toggle.setAttribute("tabindex", "0")

                            toggle.addEventListener("click", function (event) {
                                var expanded = toggle.getAttribute("aria-expanded") === "true" || false
                                toggle.setAttribute("aria-expanded", !expanded)
                                form.hidden = expanded
                                if (!expanded) {
                                    buyingOption.classList.add("expanded")
                                } else {
                                    buyingOption.classList.remove("expanded")
                                }
                                priceInfo.hidden = expanded
                            }, false)
                        }
                    }

                    function addMetrics(buyingOption) {
                        setTimeout(function () {
                            var collapsed = buybox.querySelector(".buying-option.expanded") === null
                            var form = buyingOption.querySelector(".buying-option-form")
                            var formAction = form.getAttribute("action")
                            if (form) {
                                var metricsAppendix = formAction.indexOf("?") ==! -1 ? "&" : "?"
                                metricsAppendix += "discount=" + (buyingOption.querySelector(".buying-option-price-campaign").className.indexOf("discounted") !== -1).toString()
                                metricsAppendix += "&metricsGroup=" + campaignPricesMetricsGroup
                                metricsAppendix += "&collapsed=" + collapsed.toString()
                                form.action = formAction + metricsAppendix
                            }
                        }, 1)
                    }

                    function bindModal(form, formAction, timestamp, index) {
                        var weHasBrowserSupport = window.fetch && Array.from

                        return function() {
                            var Buybox = EcommScripts ? EcommScripts.Buybox : null
                            var Modal = EcommScripts ? EcommScripts.Modal : null
                            
                            if (weHasBrowserSupport && Buybox && Modal) {
                                var modalID = "ecomm-modal_" + timestamp + "_" + index
                                
                                var modal = new Modal(modalID)
                                modal.domEl.addEventListener("close", close)
                                function close() {
                                    form.querySelector("button[type=submit]").focus()
                                }

                                var formSubmit = Buybox.interceptFormSubmit(
                                    Buybox.fetchFormAction(window.fetch),
                                    function(responseBody) {
                                        document.body.dispatchEvent(new Event("updatedCart"))
                                        Buybox.triggerModalAfterAddToCartSuccess(modal)(responseBody)
                                    },
                                    function() {
                                        form.removeEventListener("submit", formSubmit, false)
                                        form.submit()
                                    }
                                )
                                
                                form.addEventListener("submit", formSubmit, false)
                                
                                document.body.appendChild(modal.domEl)
                            }
                        }
                    }

                    function initKeyControls() {
                        document.addEventListener("keydown", function (event) {
                            if (document.activeElement.classList.contains("buying-option-price") && (event.code === "Space" || event.code === "Enter")) {
                                if (document.activeElement) {
                                    event.preventDefault()
                                    document.activeElement.click()
                                }
                            }
                        }, false)
                    }

                    function initialStateOpen() {
                        var narrowBuyboxArea = buybox.offsetWidth <= 480
                        var allOptionsInitiallyCollapsed = buybox.className.indexOf("all-options-initially-collapsed") > -1
                        ;[].slice.call(buybox.querySelectorAll(".buying-option")).forEach(function (option, index) {
                            var toggle = option.querySelector(priceNS + ".buying-option-price")
                            var form = option.querySelector(".buying-option-form")
                            var priceInfo = option.querySelector(priceNS + ".price-info")
                            if (allOptionsInitiallyCollapsed || narrowBuyboxArea && index > 0) {
                                toggle.setAttribute("aria-expanded", "false")
                                form.hidden = "hidden"
                                priceInfo.hidden = "hidden"
                            } else {
                                toggle.click()
                            }
                        })
                    }

                    initialStateOpen()

                    if (window.buyboxInitialised) return
                    window.buyboxInitialised = true

                    initKeyControls()
                    
                    if (window.fetch && isMeasuringTime) {
                        var collapsed = buybox.querySelector(".buying-option.expanded") === null
                        var metricsAppendix = ""
                        metricsAppendix += "&discount=" + (buybox.querySelector(".buying-option-price-campaign").className.indexOf("discounted") !== -1).toString()
                        metricsAppendix += "&metricsGroup=" + campaignPricesMetricsGroup
                        metricsAppendix += "&collapsed=" + collapsed.toString()
                        window.fetch("https://test-buckets.springer.com/log?v3&time=" + now + metricsAppendix)
                            .then(function (res) {
                                return res.text()
                            })
                            .catch(function () {
                                
                            })
                    }
                })()
            </script>
 <script>
                ;(function () {
                    dataLayer.push({
           "ecommerce": {
             "currency": "USD",
             "impressions": [{
  "name" : "Fuzzy Logic in Intelligent System Design",
  "id" : "978-3-319-67137-6",
  "price" : 189.00,
  "brand" : "Springer International Publishing",
  "category" : "Computational Intelligence",
  "variant" : "ebo",
  "quantity" : 1
}, {
  "name" : "Fuzzy Logic in Intelligent System Design",
  "id" : "978-3-319-67136-9",
  "price" : 249.99,
  "brand" : "Springer International Publishing",
  "category" : "Computational Intelligence",
  "variant" : "print",
  "quantity" : 1
}]
            }
         }) 
                })()
            </script>
</div>
            </div>

<li class="c-card c-list-group__item c-card--flush u-pa-16

                            <h4 class="c-card__title" data-test="chapter-title-Comparative Study of Metrics That Affect in the Performance of the Bee Colony Optimization Algorithm Through Interval Type-2 Fuzzy Logic Systems">

>Comparative Study of Metrics That Affect in the Performance of the Bee Colony Optimization Algorithm Through Interval Type-2 Fuzzy Logic Systems</a>

            </div>
        </div>

    </div>

<li class="c-card c-list-group__item c-card--flush u-pa-16
" data-test="chapter">
    <div class="c-card__body u-display-flex u-justify-content-space-between">
        <div>
                            <h4 class="c-card__title" data-test="chapter-title-Type-2 Fuzzy Approach in Multi Attribute Group Decision Making Problem">
                                <a href="/chapter/10.1007/978-3-319-67137-6_8"
    data-track="click" data-track-action="ToC link to content page" data-track-label="link"
>Type-2 Fuzzy Approach in Multi Attribute Group Decision Making Problem</a>
                            </h4>
                        
                    
            
                <ul class="c-author-list c-author-list--compact u-mb-4 u-mt-auto">
                    <li class="c-author-list__item">Zohre Moattar Husseini, Mohammad Hossein Fazel Zarandi</li>
                </ul>
            <div class="c-meta"><span class="c-meta__item u-display-inline-block" data-test="page-number">Pages 73-81</span>
            </div>
        </div>

    </div>

                                                </ol>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                
                                    <li class="c-card c-card--flush c-list-group__item">
                                        <div class="c-card__body u-display-flex u-justify-content-space-between">
                                            <div style="width: 100%">
                                                <h3 class="u-keyline u-mb-0 u-pb-8 u-pt-8" data-title="part-title" >Fuzzy Logic in Metaheuristics</h3>

            <section data-title="About this book">
                <div class="c-box c-box--shadowed u-mb-24">
                    <h2 class="c-box__heading u-mb-0" id="about-this-book">About this book</h2>
                    <div class="c-book-section">
                        This book describes recent advances in the use of fuzzy logic for the design of hybrid intelligent systems based on nature-inspired optimization and their applications in areas such as intelligent control and robotics, pattern recognition, medical diagnosis, time series prediction and optimization of complex problems. Based on papers presented at the North American Fuzzy Information Processing Society Annual Conference (NAFIPS 2017), held in Cancun, Mexico from 16 to 18 October 2017, the book is divided into nine main parts, the first of which first addresses theoretical aspects, and proposes new concepts and algorithms based on type-1 fuzzy systems. The second part consists of papers on new concepts and algorithms for type-2 fuzzy systems, and on applications of type-2 fuzzy systems in diverse areas, such as time series prediction and pattern recognition. In turn, the third part contains papers that present enhancements to meta-heuristics based on fuzzy logic techniques describing new nature-inspired optimization algorithms that use fuzzy dynamic adaptation of parameters. The fourth part presents emergent intelligent models, which range from quantum algorithms to cellular automata. The fifth part explores applications of fuzzy logic in diverse areas of medicine, such as the diagnosis of hypertension and heart diseases. The sixth part describes new computational intelligence algorithms and their applications in different areas of intelligent control, while the seventh examines the use of fuzzy logic in different mathematic models. The eight part deals with a diverse range of applications of fuzzy logic, ranging from environmental to autonomous navigation, while the ninth covers theoretical concepts of fuzzy models<br>
                    </div>
                    
    <div class="u-display-flex u-justify-content-space-between u-align-items-baseline u-flex-wrap u-mt-24">
        <a class="u-button" href="#book-header">
            <span class="u-display-flex u-align-items-center">Back to top
                <svg class="u-icon u-flex-static u-mt-4 u-ml-8" width="12" height="14" aria-hidden="true" focusable="false"><use xlink:href="#icon-arrow-up"></use></svg>
            </span>
        </a>
    </div>

                </div>
            </section>

                </div>
            </div>
            
    <div class="u-display-flex u-justify-content-space-between u-align-items-baseline u-flex-wrap u-mt-24">
        <a class="u-button" href="#book-header">
            <span class="u-display-flex u-align-items-center">Back to top
                <svg class="u-icon u-flex-static u-mt-4 u-ml-8" width="12" height="14" aria-hidden="true" focusable="false"><use xlink:href="#icon-arrow-up"></use></svg>
            </span>
        </a>
    </div>

        </div>
    </section>

            
        </main>

            </style>
 <script>
                ;(function () {
                    var timestamp = Date.now()
                    document.write('<div data-id="id_'+ timestamp +'"></div>')

                    var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0]
                    var script = document.createElement("script")
                    script.type = "text/javascript"
                    script.src = "https://buy.springer.com/assets/js/buybox-bundle-abe5f44a67.js"
                    script.id = "ecommerce-scripts-" + timestamp
                    head.appendChild(script)

                    var buybox = document.querySelector("[data-id=id_"+ timestamp +"]").parentNode

                    var now = new Date().getTime()
                    var start = 1650956400000
                    var   end = 1652338800000
                    var isMeasuringTime = now > start && now < end
                    
                    var campaignPricesMetricsGroup = initMetrics(start, end)

                    var campaignPricesActive = campaignPricesMetricsGroup === "B"

                    if (campaignPricesActive) {
                        revealCampaignPriceVersion()
                    }

                    var priceNS = campaignPricesActive ? ".buying-option-price-campaign " : ""

                    ;[].slice.call(buybox.querySelectorAll(".buying-option")).forEach(initCollapsibles)
                    ;[].slice.call(buybox.querySelectorAll(".buying-option")).forEach(addMetrics)
                    
                    if (document.cookie.indexOf("preOrderEnabled=true") > -1) {
                        ;[].slice.call(buybox.querySelectorAll(".buying-option button[type=submit]")).forEach(function (button, index) {
                            button.removeAttribute("disabled")
                        })
                        ;[].slice.call(buybox.querySelectorAll(".buying-option-pre-order-info")).forEach(function (el, index) {
                            el.style.display = 'none'
                        })
                        ;[].slice.call(buybox.querySelectorAll(".buying-option-pre-order-info.new-feature")).forEach(function (el, index) {
                            el.style.display = ''
                        })
                    }

                    function initMetrics(start, end) {
                        var metricsKey = "abMetricsCampaignPrices-v1"
                        var campaignPricesMetricsGroup = "X"
                        
                        if (!window.localStorage || !window.fetch) return campaignPricesMetricsGroup

                        if (!isMeasuringTime) {
                            window.localStorage.removeItem(metricsKey)
                            return "NONE"
                        }

                        try {
                            var metricsValue = window.localStorage.getItem(metricsKey)
                            campaignPricesMetricsGroup = metricsValue || randomDistribution(metricsKey)
                        } catch (err) {
                            console.log(err)
                        }

                        return campaignPricesMetricsGroup
                    }

                    function randomDistribution(metricsKey) {
                        var randomGroup = Math.random() < 0.5 ? "A" : "B"
                        window.localStorage.setItem(metricsKey, randomGroup)
                        return randomGroup
                    }

                    function revealCampaignPriceVersion() {
                        buybox.querySelector(".c-box").classList.add("campaign-prices")
                        buybox.querySelectorAll(".buying-option-price-campaign").forEach(function (campaignPrice) {
                            campaignPrice.removeAttribute("style")
                        })
                    }

                    function initCollapsibles(buyingOption, index) {
                        var toggle = buyingOption.querySelector(priceNS + ".buying-option-price")
                        buyingOption.classList.remove("expanded")
                        var form = buyingOption.querySelector(".buying-option-form")
                        
                        if (form) {
                            var formAction = form.getAttribute("action")
                            document.querySelector("#ecommerce-scripts-" + timestamp).addEventListener("load", bindModal(form, formAction, timestamp, index), false)
                        }
                        
                        var priceInfo = buyingOption.querySelector(priceNS + ".price-info")

                        if (toggle && form && priceInfo) {
                            toggle.setAttribute("role", "button")
                            toggle.setAttribute("tabindex", "0")

                            toggle.addEventListener("click", function (event) {
                                var expanded = toggle.getAttribute("aria-expanded") === "true" || false
                                toggle.setAttribute("aria-expanded", !expanded)
                                form.hidden = expanded
                                if (!expanded) {
                                    buyingOption.classList.add("expanded")
                                } else {
                                    buyingOption.classList.remove("expanded")
                                }
                                priceInfo.hidden = expanded
                            }, false)
                        }
                    }

                    function addMetrics(buyingOption) {
                        setTimeout(function () {
                            var collapsed = buybox.querySelector(".buying-option.expanded") === null
                            var form = buyingOption.querySelector(".buying-option-form")
                            var formAction = form.getAttribute("action")
                            if (form) {
                                var metricsAppendix = formAction.indexOf("?") ==! -1 ? "&" : "?"
                                metricsAppendix += "discount=" + (buyingOption.querySelector(".buying-option-price-campaign").className.indexOf("discounted") !== -1).toString()
                                metricsAppendix += "&metricsGroup=" + campaignPricesMetricsGroup
                                metricsAppendix += "&collapsed=" + collapsed.toString()
                                form.action = formAction + metricsAppendix
                            }
                        }, 1)
                    }

                    function bindModal(form, formAction, timestamp, index) {
                        var weHasBrowserSupport = window.fetch && Array.from

                        return function() {
                            var Buybox = EcommScripts ? EcommScripts.Buybox : null
                            var Modal = EcommScripts ? EcommScripts.Modal : null
                            
                            if (weHasBrowserSupport && Buybox && Modal) {
                                var modalID = "ecomm-modal_" + timestamp + "_" + index
                                
                                var modal = new Modal(modalID)
                                modal.domEl.addEventListener("close", close)
                                function close() {
                                    form.querySelector("button[type=submit]").focus()
                                }

                                var formSubmit = Buybox.interceptFormSubmit(
                                    Buybox.fetchFormAction(window.fetch),
                                    function(responseBody) {
                                        document.body.dispatchEvent(new Event("updatedCart"))
                                        Buybox.triggerModalAfterAddToCartSuccess(modal)(responseBody)
                                    },
                                    function() {
                                        form.removeEventListener("submit", formSubmit, false)
                                        form.submit()
                                    }
                                )
                                
                                form.addEventListener("submit", formSubmit, false)
                                
                                document.body.appendChild(modal.domEl)
                            }
                        }
                    }

                    function initKeyControls() {
                        document.addEventListener("keydown", function (event) {
                            if (document.activeElement.classList.contains("buying-option-price") && (event.code === "Space" || event.code === "Enter")) {
                                if (document.activeElement) {
                                    event.preventDefault()
                                    document.activeElement.click()
                                }
                            }
                        }, false)
                    }

                    function initialStateOpen() {
                        var narrowBuyboxArea = buybox.offsetWidth <= 480
                        var allOptionsInitiallyCollapsed = buybox.className.indexOf("all-options-initially-collapsed") > -1
                        ;[].slice.call(buybox.querySelectorAll(".buying-option")).forEach(function (option, index) {
                            var toggle = option.querySelector(priceNS + ".buying-option-price")
                            var form = option.querySelector(".buying-option-form")
                            var priceInfo = option.querySelector(priceNS + ".price-info")
                            if (allOptionsInitiallyCollapsed || narrowBuyboxArea && index > 0) {
                                toggle.setAttribute("aria-expanded", "false")
                                form.hidden = "hidden"
                                priceInfo.hidden = "hidden"
                            } else {
                                toggle.click()
                            }
                        })
                    }

                    initialStateOpen()

                    if (window.buyboxInitialised) return
                    window.buyboxInitialised = true

                    initKeyControls()
                    
                    if (window.fetch && isMeasuringTime) {
                        var collapsed = buybox.querySelector(".buying-option.expanded") === null
                        var metricsAppendix = ""
                        metricsAppendix += "&discount=" + (buybox.querySelector(".buying-option-price-campaign").className.indexOf("discounted") !== -1).toString()
                        metricsAppendix += "&metricsGroup=" + campaignPricesMetricsGroup
                        metricsAppendix += "&collapsed=" + collapsed.toString()
                        window.fetch("https://test-buckets.springer.com/log?v3&time=" + now + metricsAppendix)
                            .then(function (res) {
                                return res.text()
                            })
                            .catch(function () {
                                
                            })
                    }
                })()
            </script>
 <script>
                ;(function () {
                    dataLayer.push({
           "ecommerce": {
             "currency": "USD",
             "impressions": [{
  "name" : "Fuzzy Logic in Intelligent System Design",
  "id" : "978-3-319-67137-6",
  "price" : 189.00,
  "brand" : "Springer International Publishing",
  "category" : "Computational Intelligence",
  "variant" : "ebo",
  "quantity" : 1
}, {
  "name" : "Fuzzy Logic in Intelligent System Design",
  "id" : "978-3-319-67136-9",
  "price" : 249.99,
  "brand" : "Springer International Publishing",
  "category" : "Computational Intelligence",
  "variant" : "print",
  "quantity" : 1
}]
            }
         }) 
                })()
            </script>
</div>
            </div>
        </div>

    </div>

		<div class="single-post-wr">
			<div class="center-wr clearfix">
				<div class="left-single-content">
					<div class="post-title-wrapper">
													<h1 class="post-title">Fuzzy Logic in Artificial Intelligence: Architecture, Applications, Advantages &amp; Disadvantages</h1>
												<div class="post-info clearfix">
							<div class="author-info">
								<div class="author-info-container">
								<a href="https://www.upgrad.com/blog/author/kechit/">
											<img alt='' src='https://www.upgrad.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/1urqoyIp_400x400-96x96.jpg' srcset='https://www.upgrad.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/1urqoyIp_400x400-192x192.jpg 2x' class='avatar avatar-96 photo' height='96' width='96' loading='lazy'/>										</a>
									<div class="author-description-wrap">
										<div>
											by <a href="https://www.upgrad.com/blog/author/kechit/">Kechit Goyal</a>
										</div>
										 <p>
											Experienced Developer, Team Player and a Leader with a demonstrated history of working in startups. Strong engineering professional with a Bachelor of Technology (BTech) focused in Computer Science from Indian&hellip;										</p>
									</div>
									
								</div>
								
							</div>
							
							
							<div class="date-time-container">
							  <div class="date-info">Sep 8, 2022</div>
							  <div class="blog-dot">·</div>
							  <div class="blog-read-time">
								<span class="span-reading-time rt-reading-time"><span class="rt-label rt-prefix"></span> <span class="rt-time"> 12</span> <span class="rt-label rt-postfix">min read</span></span>							  </div>
							</div>
						</div> <!-- end of .post-info.clearfix -->
					</div> <!-- end of .post-title-wrapper -->
					<article>
						<div class="breadcrumb-wr">
							<a href="https://www.upgrad.com/blog">Home</a>&nbsp;>&nbsp;<a href="https://www.upgrad.com/blog/artificial-intelligence/" rel="category tag">Artificial Intelligence</a>&nbsp;>&nbsp;Fuzzy Logic in Artificial Intelligence: Architecture, Applications, Advantages &amp; Disadvantages						</div>

						<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">In our daily lives, you are not always able to make a decision by saying Yes or No. This is because you might face situations where there is not enough information to make a decision. Or, we may be a little confused ourselves. For example, if someone asks you whether you are available on a certain date next month, you probably won’t say Yes or No straight away. It’s because you are not completely sure that you won’t be busy on that very date next month.</span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Tricky isn’t it? </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">Fuzzy Logic in artificial intelligence</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> helps computers deal with similar situations where input data is a bit unclear.</span></p>
<p><i><span style="font-weight: 400;">Get</span></i><a href="https://www.upgrad.com/machine-learning-course/?utm_source=BLOG&amp;utm_medium=BODY&amp;utm_campaign=DV_ML_BLOG_BODY_VP_76376"><i><span style="font-weight: 400;"> machine learning training</span></i></a><i><span style="font-weight: 400;"> from the World’s top Universities. Earn Masters, Executive PGP, or Advanced Certificate Programs to fast-track your career.</span></i></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">
    <div id="ez-toc-container" class="ez-toc-v2_0_17 counter-hierarchy counter-decimal ez-toc-light-blue">
<div class="ez-toc-title-container">

</span></p>
<h2><span class="ez-toc-section" id="Why_Fuzzy_Logic"></span><strong>Why Fuzzy Logic?</strong><span class="ez-toc-section-end"></span></h2>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">The following points imply the </span><b>advantages of fuzzy logic controller.     </b></p>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">Fuzzy logic</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> is extensively used for practical and commercial purposes.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">It can control machines and consumer goods.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">It might not give precise reasoning, but acceptable reasoning.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">It deals with the uncertainty in engineering</span></li>
</ul>
<h3><span class="ez-toc-section" id="Working_of_Fuzzy_Logic"></span><strong>Working of Fuzzy Logic:</strong><span class="ez-toc-section-end"></span></h3>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Fundamentally, Fuzzy logic works on the sets. Various assumptions are used in the sets, and the output will be precisely obtained from the corresponding assumed values. The fundamental configuration used in the fuzzy logic is “if-else” sets.  Moreover, the precise answer will be attained from the input variations. The “if-else” considerations offer precise output value.</span></p><div class="upgra-ml-1" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; text-align: center; margin-bottom: 20px; " id="upgra-276920141"><a href="https://www.upgrad.com/machine-learning-ai-pgd-iiitb/?utm_source=BLOG&#038;utm_medium=BODY&#038;utm_campaign=DV_ML_PGD_BLOG_BODY_POPULAR"><img loading="lazy" src="https://s3.ap-south-1.amazonaws.com/upgrad.prod.blog/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/12143221/Executive-PG-Programme-in-Machine-Learning-AI-e1620829971376.png" alt=""  width="600" height="314"  style="display: inline-block;" /></a></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">In the working of </span><b>fuzzy logic in artificial intelligence</b><span style="font-weight: 400;">, the inputs are categorized into various memberships to achieve the outputs. The “if-else” logic assigns inputs with the function of membership. Various input variables exist when employing fuzzy logic in multi-input systems. Hence, the system output will be calculated after implementing the AND operation on the provided input variables.</span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">This logic works as a standard controller on a few platforms because it includes various parts like controller, Fuzzifier, and Defuzzifier. For example, the temperature control of the Automatic cooling system depends on the room temperature. Hence, various room temperatures are considered as input and the output is achieved through the fuzzy_logic that generates the controlled output.</span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">The </span><b>fuzzy logic</b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> controller’s working principle is that the output relies on the probability of the input’s state. It works on the output’s decision which is dependent on assumption. The fuzzy sets are used. Each set includes linguistic variables mentioning the state of the output.</span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Let’s understand </span><b>fuzzy logic</b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> with an example. Suppose A is a subset of X and every member of A exists in the intervals 0 and 1. So, set A is called a fuzzy set. Its output depends on the degree of membership of X within the set. Moreover, the fuzzy sets are graphically represented using the membership function. Note that the output depends on the logic of AND operation of the input’s state and also the input’s rate of change.</span></p>
<h2><span class="ez-toc-section" id="What_is_Fuzzy_Logic"></span><strong>What is Fuzzy Logic?</strong><span class="ez-toc-section-end"></span></h2>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">The term Fuzzy means something that is a bit vague. When a situation is vague, the computer may not be able to produce a result that is True or False. As per Boolean Logic, the value 1 refers to True and 0 means False. But a Fuzzy Logic algorithm considers all the uncertainties of a problem, where there may be possible values besides True or False.</span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">The </span><b>fuzzy logic in artificial intelligence</b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> operates on the levels of possibilities of input to obtain the definite output. It can be executed in systems with different capabilities and sizes, varying from tiny microcontrollers to huge, networked, workstation-centred control systems. Furthermore, it can be executed in software, hardware, or a combination of both.</span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">
    <h2 class="wpdt-c"
        id="wdt-table-title-33"><span class="ez-toc-section" id="In-demand_Machine_Learning_Skills"></span>In-demand Machine Learning Skills<span class="ez-toc-section-end"></span></h2>
<div class="wpdt-c row wpDataTableContainerSimpleTable wpDataTables wpDataTablesWrapper
"
    >
        <table id="wpdtSimpleTable-33"
           style="border-collapse:collapse;
                   border-spacing:0px;"
           class="wpdtSimpleTable wpDataTable"
           data-column="2"
           data-rows="2"
           data-wpID="33"
           data-responsive="0"
           data-has-header="0">

                    <tbody>        <tr class="wpdt-cell-row " >
                                <td class="wpdt-cell "
                                            data-cell-id="A1"
                    data-col-index="0"
                    data-row-index="0"
                    style=" width:50%;                    padding:10px;
                    "
                    >
                                        <a class="wpdt-link-content" href="https://www.upgrad.com/machine-learning-course/artificial-intelligence/"  rel="" target="_blank" data-cell-id="00" data-link-url="https://www.upgrad.com/machine-learning-course/artificial-intelligence/" data-link-text="Artificial Intelligence Courses" data-link-target="true" data-link-nofollow="0" data-link-noreferrer="0" data-link-sponsored="0" data-link-btn-status="0" data-link-btn-class="" data-link-content="wpdt-link-content">Artificial Intelligence Courses</a>                    </td>
                                                <td class="wpdt-cell "
                                            data-cell-id="B1"
                    data-col-index="1"
                    data-row-index="0"
                    style=" width:50%;                    padding:10px;
                    "
                    >
                                        <a class="wpdt-link-content" href="https://www.upgrad.com/machine-learning-course/tableau/"  rel="" target="_blank" data-cell-id="01" data-link-url="https://www.upgrad.com/machine-learning-course/tableau/" data-link-text="Tableau Courses" data-link-target="true" data-link-nofollow="0" data-link-noreferrer="0" data-link-sponsored="0" data-link-btn-status="0" data-link-btn-class="" data-link-content="wpdt-link-content">Tableau Courses</a>                    </td>
                                        </tr>
                            <tr class="wpdt-cell-row " >
                                <td class="wpdt-cell "
                                            data-cell-id="A2"
                    data-col-index="0"
                    data-row-index="1"
                    style="                    padding:10px;
                    "
                    >
                                        <a class="wpdt-link-content" href="https://www.upgrad.com/machine-learning-course/nlp-natural-language-processing/"  rel="" target="_blank" data-cell-id="10" data-link-url="https://www.upgrad.com/machine-learning-course/nlp-natural-language-processing/" data-link-text="NLP Courses" data-link-target="true" data-link-nofollow="0" data-link-noreferrer="0" data-link-sponsored="0" data-link-btn-status="0" data-link-btn-class="" data-link-content="wpdt-link-content">NLP Courses</a>                    </td>
                                                <td class="wpdt-cell "
                                            data-cell-id="B2"
                    data-col-index="1"
                    data-row-index="1"
                    style="                    padding:10px;
                    "
                    >
                                        <a class="wpdt-link-content" href="https://www.upgrad.com/machine-learning-course/deep-learning/"  rel="" target="_blank" data-cell-id="11" data-link-url="https://www.upgrad.com/machine-learning-course/deep-learning/" data-link-text="Deep Learning Courses" data-link-target="true" data-link-nofollow="0" data-link-noreferrer="0" data-link-sponsored="0" data-link-btn-status="0" data-link-btn-class="" data-link-content="wpdt-link-content">Deep Learning Courses</a>                    </td>
                                        </tr>
                    </table>
</div><style id='wpdt-custom-style-33'>
</style>
</span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">The term Fuzzy Logic was first described by </span><strong>Lotfi Zadeh</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;"><strong> in 1965</strong>. He thought that traditional computer logic is not capable of handling unclear or vague data. Similar to humans, there are many possible values between True and False that a computer can incorporate. These can be:</span></p>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Certainly yes</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Possibly yes</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Can’t say</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Possibly no</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Certainly no</span></li>
</ul>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Check out this simple example of Fuzzy Logic:</span></p>
<p><b>Problem</b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> – </span><i><span style="font-weight: 400;">Is it hot outside?</span></i><span style="font-weight: 400;">  </span></p>
<h4><span class="ez-toc-section" id="Boolean_Logic"></span><i><span style="font-weight: 400;">Boolean Logic</span></i><span class="ez-toc-section-end"></span></h4>
<p><b>Solution</b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> </span></p>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Yes (1.0)</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">No (0)</span></li>
</ul>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">According to conventional Boolean Logic, the algorithm will take a definite input and produce a precise result Yes or No. This is represented by 0 and 1, respectively.</span></p>
<h4><span class="ez-toc-section" id="Fuzzy_Logic"></span><i><span style="font-weight: 400;">Fuzzy Logic</span></i><span class="ez-toc-section-end"></span></h4>
<p><b>Solution</b></p>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Very hot (0.9)</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Little hot (0.20)</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Moderately hot (0.35)</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Not hot (1.0)</span></li>
</ul>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">As per the above example, Fuzzy Logic has a wider range of outputs, such as very hot, moderately hot and not hot. These values between 0 and 1 display the range of possibilities.     </span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">So, in cases where accurate reasoning cannot be provided, Fuzzy Logic provides an acceptable method of reasoning. An algorithm based on Fuzzy Logic takes all available data while solving a problem. It then takes the best possible decision according to the given input.</span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Understanding the process of a Fuzzy Logic System with an example:</span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Let’s understand the process of a Fuzzy Logic System with an example of an air conditioning system. The </span><b>fuzzy logic AI</b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> system regulates the temperature depending on input parameters such as hot, warm, warm, cold, and cold.</span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">The development process takes place in 5 steps as below:</span></p>
<ol>
<li><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Defining linguistics variables and terms for room temperature i.e. hot, warm, cold, etc.</span></li>
<li><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Build membership functions of temperature variables using</span><b> fuzzy logic in AI.</b></li>
</ol>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">iii. Make a knowledge base rule incorporating the room temperature matrix and the required room temperature.</span></p>
<ol>
<li><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Obtain the fuzzy rule using fuzzy set operations and </span><b>fuzzy logic AI</b><span style="font-weight: 400;">.</span></li>
<li><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Implementing defuzzification depends on the membership functions to obtain the output variable or the expected temperature.</span></li>
</ol>
<p><i><span style="font-weight: 400;">Charles Elkan,</span></i> <i><span style="font-weight: 400;">Assistant Professor of the Computer Science and Engineering department at the University of California at San Diego,</span></i><span style="font-weight: 400;"> shed some light upon Fuzzy Logic. He said that </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">Fuzzy Logic in artificial intelligence</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> is a generalized form of standard logic, where any concept might have a truth degree ranging between 0.0 and 1.0. Fuzzy Logic can be used for vague concepts, such as the characteristic of tallness. For example, we can say that President Clinton is tall, and the concept can have a degree of truth of 0.9.</span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">He further said that Fuzzy Logic is very useful in low-level machine control especially in consumer appliances. Some special-purpose microprocessors built on Fuzzy Logic perform </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">fuzzy operations</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> on their hardware.               </span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Let us now understand </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">Fuzzy Logic in artificial intelligence</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> by looking at its architecture.</span></p>
<p><strong>Read:</strong> <a href="https://www.upgrad.com/blog/machine-learning-project-ideas-for-beginners/">Machine Learning Project Ideas</a></p>
<h2><span class="ez-toc-section" id="Fuzzy_Logic_Architecture"></span><strong>Fuzzy Logic Architecture</strong><span class="ez-toc-section-end"></span></h2>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">The architecture of Fuzzy Logic consists of the following components:</span></p>
<h3><span class="ez-toc-section" id="Rule_base"></span><strong>Rule base</strong><span class="ez-toc-section-end"></span></h3>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">This is the set of rules along with the If-Then conditions that are used for making decisions. But, modern developments in Fuzzy Logic have reduced the number of rules in the rule base. These set of rules are also called a knowledge base. </span></p>
<h3><span class="ez-toc-section" id="Fuzzification"></span><strong>Fuzzification</strong><span class="ez-toc-section-end"></span></h3>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">This is the step where crisp numbers are converted into </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">fuzzy sets</span><span style="font-weight: 400;">. A crisp set is a set of elements that have identical properties. Based on certain logic, an element can either belong to the set or not. Crisp sets are based on binary logic – Yes or No answers.</span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Here, the error signals and physical values are converted into a normalized fuzzy subset. In any Fuzzy Logic system, the </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">fuzzifier</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> separates the input signals into five states that are:</span></p>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Large positive</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Medium positive</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Small</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Medium negative</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Large negative</span></li>
</ul>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">The fuzzification process converts crisp inputs, such as room temperature, fetched by sensors and passes them to the control system for further processing. A Fuzzy Logic control system is based on Fuzzy Logic. Common household appliances, such as air-conditioners and washing machines have Fuzzy Control systems within them.</span></p>
<p><strong>Read:</strong> <a href="https://www.upgrad.com/blog/machine-learning-engineer-salary-in-india/"><strong>Machine Learning Developer Salary in India</strong></a></p>
<h3><span class="ez-toc-section" id="Inference_Engine"></span><strong>Inference Engine</strong><span class="ez-toc-section-end"></span></h3>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">The </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">inference engine</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> determines how much the input values and the rules match. The rules are applied based on the input values received. Then, the rules are used to develop control actions. The inference engine and the knowledge base together are called a controller in a Fuzzy Logic system. </span></p>
<h3><span class="ez-toc-section" id="Defuzzification"></span><strong>Defuzzification</strong><span class="ez-toc-section-end"></span></h3>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">This is the </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">inverse process of fuzzification</span><span style="font-weight: 400;">. Here, the fuzzy values are converted into crisp values by mapping. There will be several defuzzification methods for doing this, but the best one is selected as per the input. This is a complicated process where methods, such as the maximum membership principle, weighted average method and centroid method, are used.</span></p>
<p><b>FYI:</b> <a href="https://www.upgrad.com/blog/deep-learning-free-online-course/"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Free Deep Learning Course</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">!</span></p>
<h2><span class="ez-toc-section" id="Advantages_of_Fuzzy_Logic_in_Artificial_Intelligence"></span><strong>Advantages of Fuzzy Logic in Artificial Intelligence</strong><span class="ez-toc-section-end"></span></h2>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">The benefits of using Fuzzy Logic systems are as follows:</span></p>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">It is a robust system where no precise inputs are required</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">These systems are able to accommodate several types of inputs including vague, distorted or imprecise data</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">In case the feedback sensor stops working, you can reprogram it according to the situation</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">The Fuzzy Logic algorithms can be coded using less data, so they do not occupy a huge memory space</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">As it resembles human reasoning, these systems are able to solve complex problems where ambiguous inputs are available and take decisions accordingly</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">These systems are flexible and the rules can be modified</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">The systems have a simple structure and can be constructed easily</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">You can save system costs as inexpensive sensors can be accommodated by these systems</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">It is easily understandable.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">It efficiently solves complex problems by enhancing its capability to accomplish human-like decision-making and reasoning tasks.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">It deals with uncertainties in engineering.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">The fuzzy logic’s flexibility makes it easier to adapt FLS by simply adding or deleting rules.con</span></li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Also read:</strong> <a href="https://www.upgrad.com/blog/types-of-machine-learning-algorithms/">Types of Machine Learning Algorithms with Use Cases</a></p>
<h2><span class="ez-toc-section" id="Disadvantages_of_Fuzzy_Logic_in_Artificial_Intelligence"></span><strong>Disadvantages of Fuzzy Logic in Artificial Intelligence</strong><span class="ez-toc-section-end"></span></h2>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Let us look at the drawbacks of Fuzzy Logic systems:</span></p>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">The accuracy of these systems is compromised as the system mostly works on inaccurate data and inputs</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">There is no single systematic approach to solve a problem using Fuzzy Logic. As a result, many solutions arise for a particular problem, leading to confusion</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Due to inaccuracy in results, they are not always widely accepted</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">A major drawback of Fuzzy Logic control systems is that they are completely dependent on human knowledge and expertise</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">You have to regularly update the rules of a Fuzzy Logic control system</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">These systems cannot recognize machine learning or neural networks</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">The systems require a lot of testing for validation and verification</span></li>
</ul>
<h2><span class="ez-toc-section" id="Applications_of_Fuzzy_Logic"></span><strong>Applications of Fuzzy Logic</strong><span class="ez-toc-section-end"></span></h2>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">The </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">applications of Fuzzy Logic</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> are spread across several fields. They are as follows:</span></p>
<h3><span class="ez-toc-section" id="Medicine"></span><strong>Medicine</strong><span class="ez-toc-section-end"></span></h3>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Controlling arterial pressure when providing anaesthesia to patients</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Used in diagnostic radiology  and diagnostic support systems</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Diagnosis of prostate cancer and diabetes</span></li>
</ul>
<h3><span class="ez-toc-section" id="Transportation_systems"></span><strong>Transportation systems</strong><span class="ez-toc-section-end"></span></h3>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Handling underground train operations</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Controlling train schedules</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Braking and stopping vehicles based on parameters, such as car speed, acceleration and wheel speed </span></li>
</ul>
<h3><span class="ez-toc-section" id="Defence"></span><strong>Defence</strong><span class="ez-toc-section-end"></span></h3>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Locating and recognizing targets underwater</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Supports naval decision making</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Using thermal infrared images for target recognition</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Used for controlling hypervelocity interceptors</span></li>
</ul>
<h3><span class="ez-toc-section" id="Industry"></span><strong>Industry</strong><span class="ez-toc-section-end"></span></h3>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Controlling water purification plants</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Handling problems in constraint satisfaction in structural design</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Pattern analysis for quality assurance</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Fuzzy Logic is used for tackling sludge wastewater treatment</span></li>
</ul>
<h3><span class="ez-toc-section" id="Naval_control"></span><strong>Naval control</strong><span class="ez-toc-section-end"></span></h3>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Steer ships properly</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Selecting the optimal or best possible routes for reaching a destination</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Autopilot is based on Fuzzy Logic</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Autonomous underwater vehicles are controlled using Fuzzy Logic</span></li>
</ul>
<h3><span class="ez-toc-section" id="Washing_systems_powered_by_Fuzzy_Logic"></span><strong>Washing systems powered by Fuzzy Logic</strong><span class="ez-toc-section-end"></span></h3>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Modern washing machines powered by Fuzzy Logic</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> are becoming popular these days. They have sensors that continuously track variations in temperature. It adjusts the controls and operations accordingly. These systems perform well, and are productive and cost efficient.</span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">For best wash results, Fuzzy Logic controls the washing process, water temperature, spin speed, wash time, water intake and rinse performance. Advanced machines do the following:</span></p>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Check the load of the machine to prevent overloading</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Check the hardness of water and determine the type of cloth material</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Advises the user on the optimal amount of detergent. They also check whether the detergent is in liquid or powdered form</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">They learn from previous washing experiences, and memorize algorithms to enhance the washing results</span></li>
</ul>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Most of the systems are based on energy-saving technology that helps you save power while washing clothes. These features help you save energy even if you wash lots of clothes 2 to 3 times a week. The sensors monitor the entire washing process, and make necessary adjustments and corrections for best washing outcomes.</span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Fuzzy Logic in these washing machines checks the amount of dirt and grime on clothes, the direction of the spin and the quantity of soap required. For better spinning, the washing load is properly balanced. In case an imbalance is detected, the spinning speed is decreased. Furthermore, balancing the washing load helps to reduce the spinning noise.</span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Companies such as Panasonic use similar technology in their dishwashers. Fuzzy Logic is used in adjusting the cleaning cycles of dishwashers, along with the wash and rinse methods. The performance of the machine also depends upon the number of dishes put into the washer.</span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">
    <h2 class="wpdt-c"
        id="wdt-table-title-9"><span class="ez-toc-section" id="Popular_Machine_Learning_and_Artificial_Intelligence_Blogs"></span>Popular Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence Blogs<span class="ez-toc-section-end"></span></h2>

                                        <a class="wpdt-link-content" href="https://www.upgrad.com/blog/robotics-engineer-salary-in-india-all-roles/"  rel="" target="_blank" data-cell-id="10" data-link-url="https://www.upgrad.com/blog/robotics-engineer-salary-in-india-all-roles/" data-link-text="Robotics Engineer Salary in India : All Roles" data-link-target="true" data-link-nofollow="0" data-link-noreferrer="0" data-link-sponsored="0" data-link-btn-status="0" data-link-btn-class="" data-link-content="wpdt-link-content">Robotics Engineer Salary in India : All Roles</a>                    </td>

                    >

                    >
                                        <a class="wpdt-link-content" href="https://www.upgrad.com/blog/trends-in-artificial-intelligence-machine-learning/"  rel="" target="_blank" data-cell-id="21" data-link-url="https://www.upgrad.com/blog/trends-in-artificial-intelligence-machine-learning/" data-link-text="Top 7 Trends in Artificial Intelligence &amp; Machine Learning" data-link-target="true" data-link-nofollow="0" data-link-noreferrer="0" data-link-sponsored="0" data-link-btn-status="0" data-link-btn-class="" data-link-content="wpdt-link-content">Top 7 Trends in Artificial Intelligence &amp; Machine Learning</a>                    </td>

                    >
                                        <a class="wpdt-link-content" href="https://www.upgrad.com/blog/machine-learning-with-r/"  rel="" target="_blank" data-cell-id="22" data-link-url="https://www.upgrad.com/blog/machine-learning-with-r/" data-link-text="Machine Learning with R: Everything You Need to Know" data-link-target="true" data-link-nofollow="0" data-link-noreferrer="0" data-link-sponsored="0" data-link-btn-status="0" data-link-btn-class="" data-link-content="wpdt-link-content">Machine Learning with R: Everything You Need to Know</a>                    </td>
                                        </tr>
                    </table>
</div><style id='wpdt-custom-style-9'>
</style>
</span></p>
<p><strong> Some more applications of Fuzzy Logic:</strong></p>
<ol>
<li><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Automotive Systems: Using different technologies, including the Fuzzy Logic System, the automotive industry intends to improve vehicle quality. The</span><b> fuzzy logic in AI</b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> uses them in the below areas:</span></li>
</ol>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Preparing trainable fuzzy systems for idle speed regulation.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Shift scheduling for supporting an automatic transmission.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Enhancing the automatic transmission’s efficiency.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Developing intelligent highway systems.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Implementing and improving traffic control.</span></li>
</ul>
<ol start="2">
<li><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Business: Organizations globally are using the benefits of Fuzzy control for the below reasons:</span></li>
</ol>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">To design effective decision-making support systems.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Personnel assessment in large-scale organizations.</span></li>
</ul>
<ol start="3">
<li><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Security: Fuzzy Logic Systems lays a profound impact on the security protocols and is quickly being employed in the following:</span></li>
</ol>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Various security applications and products.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Decision Systems for security training.</span></li>
</ul>
<ol start="4">
<li><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Finance: In the finance and banking field, the </span><b>fuzzy system in artificial intelligence </b><span style="font-weight: 400;">plays a key role in:</span></li>
</ol>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Fund management.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Fraud Prevention.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Stock market predictions.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Transfer control.</span></li>
</ul>
<ol start="5">
<li><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Electronics: The fuzzy logic system is being used in the electronics field to control:</span></li>
</ol>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Air conditioning systems</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Automatic exposure in the video cameras</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Washing machine timing</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Humidity in rooms</span></li>
</ul>
<ol start="6">
<li><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Pattern Recognition &amp; Classification: This sector is using the Fuzzy Logic System for:</span></li>
</ol>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Fuzzy image search.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Command analysis.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Facial characteristics analysis.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Speech and handwriting recognition.</span></li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Significance of Membership Function in Fuzzy Logic:</strong></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Membership functions (MFs) are the fundamental building blocks of the Fuzzy Set Theory which is used in the fuzzy logic controller. It plays a key role in the fuzzy representation’s performance. It portrays the fuzziness described using the </span><b>fuzzy system in artificial intelligence </b><span style="font-weight: 400;">and also depicts the amount of truth in the fuzzy logic.</span></p><div class="upgra-ml-2" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; text-align: center; margin-bottom: 20px; " id="upgra-1128868504"><a href="https://www.upgrad.com/machine-learning-ai-pgd-iiitb/?utm_source=BLOG&#038;utm_medium=BODY&#038;utm_campaign=DV_ML_PGD_BLOG_BODY_POPULAR"><img loading="lazy" src="https://s3.ap-south-1.amazonaws.com/upgrad.prod.blog/blog/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/12143221/Executive-PG-Programme-in-Machine-Learning-AI-e1620829971376.png" alt=""  width="600" height="314"  style="display: inline-block;" /></a></div>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">It is a graph that specifies how each point in the input space is plotted to membership value ranging between 0 and 1. The Membership Functions’ key objective is to plot the non-fuzzy input values to the fuzzy linguistic terms, and vice versa.</span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Different types of membership functions are:</span></p>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Singleton Fuzzy Logic System.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Trapezoidal.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Gaussian Fuzzifier.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Triangular Fuzzifier.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2><span class="ez-toc-section" id="Conclusion"></span><strong>Conclusion</strong><span class="ez-toc-section-end"></span></h2>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Although </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">Fuzzy Logic in artificial intelligence</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> helps to mimic human reasoning, these systems need expert guidance to be built. This lets you rely on the experience of experts who have a better understanding of the system. Fuzzy Logic can also be used for enhancing the execution of algorithms. IBM Watson uses </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">Fuzzy Logic and fuzzy semantics</span><span style="font-weight: 400;">.</span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Fuzzy logic assists in understanding how people will perform in a dynamic environment in an unidentified way and helps regulate machines, providing a range of adequate thinking that can happen as a subset of the human decision-making process.</span></p>

This course has been crafted keeping in mind various kinds of students interested in Machine Learning, offering 1-1 mentorship and much more.</p>
        <section class="sc_fs_faq sc_card">
            <div>
				<h2><span class="ez-toc-section" id="What_are_the_applications_of_fuzzy_logic_in_real_life"></span>What are the applications of fuzzy logic in real life?<span class="ez-toc-section-end"></span></h2>                <div>
					                    <p>
						Fuzzy logic is used for the same applications as regular logic, but with the ability to handle inexact reasoning. Fuzzy logic’s main application is for artificial intelligence. Fuzzy logic is used in factory controllers and industrial software. Also, most modern appliances in the kitchen, home theatre and entertainment, air conditioning and heating, microwave, digital camera, refrigerator and TV, etc. use fuzzy logic. The system is a two-way street. It uses fuzzy logic to make intelligent decisions, but customers respond in fuzziness, too. So, in order to make the system more accurate, researchers apply fuzzy science on such devices.                    </p>
                </div>
            </div>
        </section>
	        <section class="sc_fs_faq sc_card">
            <div>
				<h2><span class="ez-toc-section" id="What_are_the_limitations_of_fuzzy_logic"></span>What are the limitations of fuzzy logic?<span class="ez-toc-section-end"></span></h2>                <div>
					                    <p>
						Fuzzy logic is a way to represent logical statements using real values instead of the conventional binary values. Fuzzy logic has two major limitations: the handling of imprecise data and the inherent inference of human thinking. Both these problems are related to each other. If the data is imprecise in the system, then a human being cannot infer the knowledge or relation. It is hoped that future research will lead to solving these problems.                    </p>
                </div>
            </div>
        </section>
	        <section class="sc_fs_faq sc_card">
            <div>
				<h2><span class="ez-toc-section" id="What_are_the_benefits_of_fuzzy_control"></span>What are the benefits of fuzzy control?<span class="ez-toc-section-end"></span></h2>                <div>
					                    <p>
						Fuzzy control allows control based on the actual output from the process, as opposed to control based on a setpoint. This means that the output of a control loop is not fixed at a specific value, but is allowed to vary within a specific range. This gives better control than fixed-point control, especially in applications with a non-linear relationship between input and output.                    </p>
                </div>
            </div>
        </section>
