                                        <p>The tremendous rise in data in these times have created an urgent need to talk to them. Almost all the big industries have already adopted machine learning to benefit from it. Apart from gaining machine learning certification, let us understand a few of the benefits of mastering skills gained from PGP AI courses:</p>

<ul><li><b>Better Career Opportunities and Growth</b></li></ul>

<p>According to Forbes, the global machine learning market was valued at $1.58B in 2017. It is expected to reach $20.83B in 2024, growing at a CAGR of 44.06% between 2017 and 2024. Open jobs on LinkedIn with machine learning expertise in the U.S. reflects its growing dominance. According to LinkedIn, there are around 77,007 jobs in the U.S. today that list machine learning as a required skill, and 16,250 in India. If you are looking to take your career to another level and involve yourself and be a part of something that is global of contemporary relevance and huge future demand then this AI ML certification is for you.</p>

<ul><li><b>Lack of Machine Learning Skills in the world</b></li></ul>

<p>Data is screaming to tell you the truthful insights; it just needs a right resource who speaks its tongue. The data and its interpretation demand in the companies are increasing exponentially, but the lack of potential machine learning candidates in the world has created a huge gap. Here's the opportunity for you to easily get into the domain with the right guidance and machine learning skill. Our Artificial Intelligence Course syllabus with NIT Warangal have been designed by Top Experts in the field of AIML industries.</p>

<ul><li><b>Better Salaries</b></li></ul>

<p>The demand for the machine learning engineer is much more than the supply is way too less. The vast bridge between the demand and supply of machine learning engineers have resulted in better salaries. The average salary for a Machine Learning Engineer in India is ₹701,354 and $112,837 in the US. Hence, the demand for this AI and Machine Learning course is at its peak worldwide.</p>

<div class="modal fade" id="industryProjectsMoreDetailsModal" tabindex="-1" aria-labelledby="industryProjectsMoreDetailsModal" aria-hidden="true">
  <div class="modal-dialog center_open_pop">
    <div class="modal-content">
    <span class="close_btn icon-cross" data-dismiss="modal"></span>
                                   <div class="modal-body project_popup_1">
                                                 <div class="details_card">
                                <div class="modal_header">
                                    <img class="lazyImages" data-src="pgp_new_industry_projects_961_1603693955.svg" fullBase="true"  alt="User Image">
                                    <div class="details_section">
                                        <h3>Building a RASA Based Chatbot</h3>
                                    </div>                
                                </div>
                                <div class="cap_section">
                                    <span class="red_cap">Beginner</span>
                                    <span class="green_cap">Live Session</span>
                                </div>
                                <div class="modal_content">
                                    Rasa is a framework for developing AI-powered, industrial grade, powerful chatbots. The developers use it to create intent-based chatbots. In this project, we are going to understand some of the most important basic aspects of the Rasa framework and use RASA NLU and RASA CORE to build a conversational chatbot.
<br><br><span style="color:#192f60"><b>Tools Used:</b></span> RASA NLU, RASA Core                                </div>
                            </div>
                                                  <div class="details_card">
                                <div class="modal_header">
                                    <img class="lazyImages" data-src="pgp_new_industry_projects_961_1603694220.svg" fullBase="true"  alt="User Image">
                                    <div class="details_section">
                                        <h3>Gnar Automobiles</h3>
                                    </div>                
                                </div>
                                <div class="cap_section">
                                    <span class="red_cap">Beginner</span>
                                    <span class="green_cap">Live Session</span>
                                </div>
                                <div class="modal_content">
                                    Gnar Automobiles engages in the distribution and sale of automobiles and light commercial vehicles. The owner of the Gnar Automobiles deals with a number of distributors across countries in different origins. 
As every origin sends cars with various specifications. The owner wants to determine the origin of the cars based on the specifications of the cars to further increase business opportunities.
<br><br><span style="color:#192f60"><b>Tools Used:</b></span> Pandas, Matplotlib, Numpy, MLXtend                                </div>
                            </div>
                                                  <div class="details_card">
                                <div class="modal_header">
                                    <img class="lazyImages" data-src="pgp_new_industry_projects_961_1603694409.svg" fullBase="true"  alt="User Image">
                                    <div class="details_section">
                                        <h3>Chronic Disease Prediction </h3>
                                    </div>                
                                </div>
                                <div class="cap_section">
                                    <span class="red_cap">Beginner</span>
                                    <span class="green_cap">Live Session</span>
                                </div>
                                <div class="modal_content">
                                    Chronic kidney disease (CKD) is a covert disease. Accurate prediction of CKD progression overtime is necessary for reducing its costs and mortality rates. The dataset is taken over a 2-month period in India. It has 400 rows with 26 features like red blood cells, pedal edema, sugar, etc. Use this to classify whether a patient has chronic kidney disease.

<br><br><span style="color:#192f60"><b>Tools Used:</b></span> Pandas, SKLearn                                </div>
                            </div>
                                                  <div class="details_card">
                                <div class="modal_header">
                                    <img class="lazyImages" data-src="pgp_new_industry_projects_961_1603694463.svg" fullBase="true"  alt="User Image">
                                    <div class="details_section">
                                        <h3> Beer Consumption Prediction</h3>
                                    </div>                
                                </div>
                                <div class="cap_section">
                                    <span class="red_cap">Beginner</span>
                                    <span class="green_cap">Live Session</span>
                                </div>
                                <div class="modal_content">
                                    Beer is the most consumed drink in the world. Not without reason, it is perfect for almost every situation, from happy hour to large wedding parties. You will be given a data sample collected in São Paulo, Brazil. Use this to predict the quantity of beer consumption based on the features that contain climate conditions of a given day.
<br><br><span style="color:#192f60"><b>Tools Used:</b></span> Pandas, Seaborn, SKLearn                                </div>
                            </div>
                                                  <div class="details_card">
                                <div class="modal_header">
                                    <img class="lazyImages" data-src="pgp_new_industry_projects_961_1603694535.svg" fullBase="true"  alt="User Image">
                                    <div class="details_section">
                                        <h3>Retail Customer Segmentation</h3>
                                    </div>                
                                </div>
                                <div class="cap_section">
                                    <span class="red_cap">Beginner</span>
                                    <span class="green_cap">Live Session</span>
                                </div>
                                <div class="modal_content">
                                    The data scientists at Big Mart have collected 2013 sales data of 1559 products across 10 stores in different cities. Big Mart CEO wants to understand the customer demographics and customer retention (Customer who can converge easily) so that the marketing team can market their products and services by conducting various strategies accordingly.
<br><br><span style="color:#192f60"><b>Tools Used:</b></span> Pandas, Scipy, Numpy                                </div>
                            </div>
                                                  <div class="details_card">
                                <div class="modal_header">
                                    <img class="lazyImages" data-src="pgp_new_industry_projects_961_1603694609.svg" fullBase="true"  alt="User Image">
                                    <div class="details_section">
                                        <h3>Credit Score Analysis</h3>
                                    </div>                
                                </div>
                                <div class="cap_section">
                                    <span class="red_cap">Beginner</span>
                                    <span class="green_cap">Live Session</span>
                                </div>
                                <div class="modal_content">
                                    Sydney based Caltech bank plans a new loan scheme for its customers and wants to analyze its customer data to find out how the customer's earning is associated with their credit score. Use clustering methods to find the high credit score clusters of customers. It will summarize the existing loan scheme and help Caltech bank to decide about the new loan scheme.

<br><br><span style="color:#192f60"><b>Tools Used:</b></span> Pandas, Scipy, Numpy                                </div>
                            </div>
                                                  <div class="details_card">
                                <div class="modal_header">
                                    <img class="lazyImages" data-src="pgp_new_industry_projects_961_1603694697.svg" fullBase="true"  alt="User Image">
                                    <div class="details_section">
                                        <h3> Housing Price Prediction</h3>
                                    </div>                
                                </div>
                                <div class="cap_section">
                                    <span class="red_cap">Beginner</span>
                                    <span class="green_cap">Live Session</span>
                                </div>
                                <div class="modal_content">
                                    The dataset is collected from the 1990 California census containing data of one row per census group. The dataset has various demographics and details captured. Based on this data, we have to create a model using Pandas, Scipy, Numpy that can determine the housing price of the house based on the details provided.

<br><br><span style="color:#192f60"><b>Tools Used:</b></span> Pandas, Scipy, Numpy                                </div>
                            </div>
                                                  <div class="details_card">
                                <div class="modal_header">
                                    <img class="lazyImages" data-src="pgp_new_industry_projects_961_1603695097.svg" fullBase="true"  alt="User Image">
                                    <div class="details_section">
                                        <h3>Exploratory Data Analysis</h3>
                                    </div>                
                                </div>
                                <div class="cap_section">
                                    <span class="red_cap">Beginner</span>
                                    <span class="green_cap">Live Session</span>
                                </div>
                                <div class="modal_content">
                                    You will be provided with a dataset containing records from the new crime incident report system, which includes a reduced set of fields focused on capturing the incident and when and where it occurred. The Boston Police Department has decided to analyse and explore the data to find some useful insights which might help them in finding the pattern in the crime.

<br><br><span style="color:#192f60"><b>Tools Used:</b></span> Pandas, Seaborn                                </div>
                            </div>
                                                  <div class="details_card">
                                <div class="modal_header">
                                    <img class="lazyImages" data-src="pgp_new_industry_projects_961_1603694778.svg" fullBase="true"  alt="User Image">
                                    <div class="details_section">
                                        <h3>Forecast Air Passenger Traffic</h3>
                                    </div>                
                                </div>
                                <div class="cap_section">
                                    <span class="red_cap">Beginner</span>
                                    <span class="green_cap">Live Session</span>
                                </div>
                                <div class="modal_content">
                                    An Airline called Star Air has the data of its passengers across months. The data is classified in date/time and the passengers travelling per month. Build a model to forecast the demand (passenger traffic) in Airplanes. You will learn to use Pandas, Scipy, Numpy with hands-on experience of other tools, features and libraries.

<br><br><span style="color:#192f60"><b>Tools Used:</b></span> Pandas, scipy, Numpy                                </div>
                            </div>
                                      </div>
                                  <div class="modal-body project_popup_2">
                                                 <div class="details_card">
                                <div class="modal_header">
                                    <img class="lazyImages" data-src="pgp_new_industry_projects_961_1601958491.svg" fullBase="true"  alt="User Image">
                                    <div class="details_section">
                                        <h3>Twitter Sentiment Analysis</h3>
                                    </div>                
                                </div>
                                <div class="cap_section">
                                    <span class="red_cap">Intermediate</span>
                                    <span class="green_cap">Live Session</span>
                                </div>
                                <div class="modal_content">
                                    Analyzing the tweets helps us in understanding the thoughts and sentiments of people over any popular topic. It helps us to understand what people are thinking about the trend. Here, as a part of this project, you will use Tweepy, Textblob, nltk, and other NLP libraries to analyze the sentiments from the Trending Twitter’s tags.

<br><br><span style="color:#192f60"><b>Tools Used:</b></span> Tweepy, Textblob, NLTK                                </div>
                            </div>
                                                  <div class="details_card">
                                <div class="modal_header">
                                    <img class="lazyImages" data-src="pgp_new_industry_projects_961_1603694069.svg" fullBase="true"  alt="User Image">
                                    <div class="details_section">
                                        <h3>Resort Menu Prediction</h3>
                                    </div>                
                                </div>
                                <div class="cap_section">
                                    <span class="red_cap">Intermediate</span>
                                    <span class="green_cap">Live Session</span>
                                </div>
                                <div class="modal_content">
                                    Emerald Oyster is affected by the high cost of meals at multiple restaurants within the resort. To resolve this issue, they need a new menu and choices based on the economical condition of the customer. Your task will be to identify the economic class of the customer based on the data collected so that the board can resolve this with proper remodeling.
<br><br><span style="color:#192f60"><b>Tools Used:</b></span> Pandas, SKLearn, Matplotlib, Seaborn, Numpy                                </div>
                            </div>
                                                  <div class="details_card">
                                <div class="modal_header">
                                    <img class="lazyImages" data-src="pgp_new_industry_projects_961_1603694280.svg" fullBase="true"  alt="User Image">
                                    <div class="details_section">
                                        <h3>Telecom Churn Prediction</h3>
                                    </div>                
                                </div>
                                <div class="cap_section">
                                    <span class="red_cap">Intermediate</span>
                                    <span class="green_cap">Live Session</span>
                                </div>
                                <div class="modal_content">
                                    A telecom company wants you to analyze its data, to keep its customers. You will be provided with the 'Telecom Churn' dataset. Use it to create a model to predict which customer will switch to other telecom service providers, based on the relevant customer data.

<br><br><span style="color:#192f60"><b>Tools Used:</b></span> Pandas, Numpy,, Seaborn, Matplotlib, SKLearn                                </div>
                            </div>
                                                  <div class="details_card">
                                <div class="modal_header">
                                    <img class="lazyImages" data-src="pgp_new_industry_projects_1268_1606401649.svg" fullBase="true"  alt="User Image">
                                    <div class="details_section">
                                        <h3>Analyze & Visualize Employee Attrition</h3>
                                    </div>                
                                </div>
                                <div class="cap_section">
                                    <span class="red_cap">Intermediate</span>
                                    <span class="green_cap">Live Session</span>
                                </div>
                                <div class="modal_content">
                                    Employee retention is one of the biggest metrics that a company should have in mind when thinking of growth. Employee attrition is caused when the total strength of the company is greatly reduced as more employees leave the company than expected. Uncover the factors that lead to employee attrition and explore the reasons as to why people are leaving the organization and predict whether an employee will leave the organization or not by creating a Web App using Streamlit that takes inputs from user's online.

<br><br><span style="color:#192f60"><b>Tools Used:</b></span> Sklearn, PyCaret, Streamlit, SHAP, Pandas-Profiling                                </div>
                            </div>
                                                  <div class="details_card">
                                <div class="modal_header">
                                    <img class="lazyImages" data-src="pgp_new_industry_projects_1268_1606401669.svg" fullBase="true"  alt="User Image">
                                    <div class="details_section">
                                        <h3>Analyze & Visualize Video Games Sales</h3>
                                    </div>                
                                </div>
                                <div class="cap_section">
                                    <span class="red_cap">Intermediate</span>
                                    <span class="green_cap">Live Session</span>
                                </div>
                                <div class="modal_content">
                                    SRS Ltd. is a Korean and video game company headquartered in Seoul. You as a Data Scientist is required to analyze the trend in Global Sales according to the Genres on the Video Games Sales Dataset from 1980 & visualize the change in Net Sales of different publishers from the year 2005 to 2015.
<br><br><span style="color:#192f60"><b>Tools Used:</b></span> Plotly Express, Streamlit                                </div>
                            </div>
                                                  <div class="details_card">
                                <div class="modal_header">
                                    <img class="lazyImages" data-src="pgp_new_industry_projects_1268_1606401723.svg" fullBase="true"  alt="User Image">
                                    <div class="details_section">
                                        <h3>Predict Ad-Click</h3>
                                    </div>                
                                </div>
                                <div class="cap_section">
                                    <span class="red_cap">Intermediate</span>
                                    <span class="green_cap">Live Session</span>
                                </div>
                                <div class="modal_content">
                                    In online advertising, click-through rate (CTR) is a very important metric for evaluating ad performance. As a result, click prediction systems are essential and widely used for sponsored search and real-time bidding. In this demo Explore the Ad click data and use Logistic Regression                                                                                                                                                                                                                    to predict who is more likely to click the ad! based on the features of the user.
<br><br><span style="color:#192f60"><b>Tools Used:</b></span>Sklearn, Pandas Profiling, Sweetviz                                </div>
                            </div>

                                <div class="modal_header">

For example - to categorize personal multimedia collections, for automatic product tagging in online catalogs, and other areas of business and researches. Use CNN and LSTM to create a model that can automatically add captions to the image.

Explore the dataset to find the insights and predict the winning probability of the player based on several attributes.

                                    <span class="red_cap">Advance</span>
                                    <span class="green_cap">Live Session</span>
                                </div>
                                <div class="modal_content">
                                    Credit card fraud happens when a fraudster or a thief steals your credit card or the information from that card to make unauthorized purchases in your name or take out cash advances using your account.
Credit card companies such as Citibank,  HSBC, and American Express need to recognize fraudulent credit card transactions so that customers are not charged for items that they did not purchase.
In this demo, you have to build a classification model to identify fraudulent credit card transactions.
<br><br><span style="color:#192f60"><b>Tools Used:</b></span> Sklearn, PyCaret, Streamlit, ELI5, Pandas-Profiling                                </div>

To name a few such retails, healthcare, search engine, digital marketing, finance. and education are the major beneficiaries.\r\n\r\nThe machine learning market is expected to grow from USD 1.03 Billion in 2016 to USD 8.81 Billion by 2022, at a Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) of 44.1% during the forecast period. Machine learning-driven solutions are being leveraged by organizations to improve customer experience, ROI, and to gain a competitive edge in business. Big players in the field like Google, IBM, Microsoft, Apple, and Salesforce are already leveraging ML benefits.\r\n"}},{"@type":"Question","name":"What is the admission process for this AI and Machine Learning Training?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"After you fill-up the basic details for this PG Diploma in Artificial Intelligence course online, you will be asked to complete a detailed application form to shortlist your application for screening. 			<div class="swiper-container home-slider inner-pages" id="home-slider">
				<div class="swiper-wrapper">
					<div class="swiper-slide">
						<div class="caption-box">
							<h1>Fuzzy Logic Systems</h1>
							<div class="heading-underline"></div>
							
						</div>
					</div>

				</div>
			</div>
		</section>

	

		<section class="blog_inner">
				<div class="container">
						<div class="row">
								<div class="leftcolumn">
								  <div class="card">
									<div class="fakeimg p-0">
										<img src="assets/images/FLS.jpg" alt="">
									</div>
									<div class="blogger_name">
											<p class="pb-1"><i class="fa fa-user"></i></p>
											<p>03 Mar 2020 </p>
									</div>
									<div class="sharethis-inline-share-buttons"></div>
									<div class="inner_page pt-2">
                                            <p><strong>Artificial Intelligence (AI)</strong> , the tech of tomorrow, has gone through tremendous growth in the past few years. Adopted and implemented across industries, it is rapidly transforming business structures and functions, with development being no exception. Moreover, this tech has given way to new theories, algorithms, logic, techniques, etc. which are reshaping the way systems are built. Among these new innovations, Fuzzy Logic Systems is another crucial technique that is enabling machines to be on par with humans intelligence. Used widely, along with numerous other AI algorithms, <strong>Fuzzy Logic Systems</strong> is a vital part of various AI applications and makes systems capable of performing human-like reasoning. So, let’s understand ‘What is Fuzzy <strong>Logic Systems</strong>?’ and discuss its areas of application, architecture, advantages, and more. </p> 
                                            <br>
					
											<i>
												But, before we jump into Fuzzy Logic Systems, understanding the concepts of Fuzzy Logic is extremely crucial, as it plays an integral part in Fuzzy Logic Systems.  
                                                </i>
                                                <br>
                                                <br>
                                                <strong>So, let’s begin. </strong>
                                                <br>
                                                <br>
					
											<div class="heading_content mb-5">
												<h3>Introduction to Fuzzy Logic: </h3>
                                                <p>One of the important legacies of Artificial Intelligence, Fuzzy Logic was invented by <strong> Lotfi Zadeh</strong>, the professor of UC Berkeley in California, in 1965. He came up with this theory while he was working on the problem of computer understanding of <strong>Natural Languages</strong>, which cannot be translated into absolute terms of 0 and 1.  </p> 
                                                <br>
                                                <br>
                                                <p>Like traditional and classical logic Fuzzy Logic does not categorize information into binary patterns (0 or 1), like Yes or No, Day or Night, <strong>True or False</strong>, etc. but instead focuses on categorizing the gray areas in the scenarios. It is a computing approach, based on the Degrees of Truth, that incorporates intermediate values like <strong>partial truth</strong>. Other important characteristics of Fuzzy Logic are:  </p>
                                                <br>
                                                <ul>
                                                    <li> It helps mimic human-like logic.  </li>
                                                    <li>Highly suitable for uncertain or approximate reasoning.</li>
                                                    <li>It views inference as a process of propagating elastic constraints.</li>
                                                    <li>Needs to be built with expert's guidance.</li>
                                                    <li>It helps build nonlinear functions of arbitrary complexity.</li>
                                                    <li>It might have two values that represent two possible solutions. </li>
                                                    
                                                </ul>
											</div>
					
											<div class="heading_content">
													<h3>Implementations of Fuzzy Logic:  </h3>
                                                    <p>Fuzzy Logic is an extremely beneficial theory that offers valuable flexibility for reasoning in Artificial Intelligence (AI). Moreover, it is the underlying concept that enables Fuzzy Logic Systems to work as per expectations. Currently, this tech is implemented in the following:</p>
                                                    <br>
													<ul>
														<li> Systems with varying sizes and capabilities, like micro-controller, large networked or workstation-based systems.  </li>
														<li> In hardware, software or a combination of both.  </li>
														</li>
                                                    </ul>
                                                    <br>
                                                    <p>That’s not all, neural networks, data mining, case-based reasoning, business rules, etc. are other few areas that are profiting from a <strong>fuzzy system</strong>. </p>
											</div>
					
											<div class="heading_content pt-5">
												<h3>What is the Need for Fuzzy Logic?   </h3>
                                                <p>From offering valuable flexibility for reasoning to being implemented for practical and commercial reasons, Fuzzy Logic is needed across the spectrum to perform a variety of functions, such as: </p>
                                                <br>
                                                <ul>
                                                    <li><strong>Control systems</strong> and <strong>consumer products.</strong></li>
                                                    <li>Get acceptable reasoning. </li>
                                                    <li>Deal with the uncertainty in engineering.</li>
                                                </ul>
					
												<h3 class="mt-5">What is Fuzzy Logic Systems?</h3>
												<p>An efficient method for performing human-like reasoning, the Fuzzy Logic System relies on Fuzzy Logic to perform reasoning, in conditions with uncertainty and displays complex and uncertain systems. It uses the Theory of <strong>Fuzzy sets</strong> to map crisp inputs into crisp outputs. The Fuzzy <strong>Set Theory</strong> performs a gradual assessment of the <strong>degree of membership</strong> in a set, describing it with the help of the <strong>membership function</strong> value in the real unit interval (0, 1) the Boolean logic on which the modern computer is based.</p> <br>
					
												<p>Used widely across numerous industries for system identification, pattern recognition problems, etc., Fuzzy Logic Systems require a little amount of data to prepare a robust model. Moreover, it needs only a limited amount of memory to complete execution. </p><br>
					
												
					
												<h3 class="mt-5">Example of a Fuzzy Logic System:   </h3>
                                                <p>Let us consider a <strong>Fuzzy Logic System example</strong> of an air conditioning system. In such a case, the fuzzy system controls the temperature, based on the input parameters, like very cold, cold, warm, very warm, or hot.  </p>
                                                <br>
                                                <p>The process of development will take place in 5 steps, which are: </p>
                                                <br>
                                                <p><strong>1. Defining linguistics variables</strong> and terms for room temperature, cold, hot, warm, etc. </p>
                                                <p><strong>2. Construct membership functions</strong>  of temperature variables.</p>
                                                <p><strong>3. Prepare knowledge base rule,</strong> which includes a matrix of the room temperature and the required room temperature. </p>
                                                <p><strong>4. Obtain the fuzzy rule</strong>  with the help of <strong>fuzzy set operations.</strong></p>
                                                <p><strong>5. </strong>5.Finally, based on the membership functions, <strong>perform defuzzification</strong> to get the output variable or the expected temperature. </p>
					
												<h3 class="mt-5">Fuzzy Logic Systems Architecture:   </h3>
                                                <p>Fuzzy Logic Systems are capable of performing their functions accurately because of its architecture. There are four types of fuzzy logic systems, namely:  </p>
                                                <br>
                                                <br>
                                                <p><strong>1. </strong><strong>Fuzzification Module:</strong> Also known as <strong>Fuzzifiers</strong>, fuzzification converts inputs or the crisp numbers into fuzzy sets. It divides the input signal into five major steps: </p>
                                                <br>
                                                <br>
                                                <div class="fuzzy-table d-flex align-items-center justify-content-around">
                                                    <div class="left-col">
                                                        <p>LP</p>
                                                        <p>MP</p>
                                                        <p>S</p>
                                                        <p>MN</p>
                                                        <p>LN</p>
                                                    </div>
                                                    <div class="right-col">
                                                        <p>X is Large Positive</p>
                                                        <p>X is Medium Positive</p>
                                                        <p>X is Small</p>
                                                        <p>X is Medium Negative</p>
                                                        <p>X is Large Negative</p>
                                                    </div>
                                                </div>
                                                <br>
                                                <p><strong>2. Rules:</strong> Also known as the <strong>Knowledge base</strong>, the <strong>fuzzy rule</strong> contains all the rules as well as the if-then conditions that are offered by the experts to control the decision-making system. </p>
                                                <br>
                                                <p><strong>3. Inference Engine:</strong> This aspect of the architecture helps determine the degree of match between fuzzy input and the rules as per the input fields. Moreover, it determines the rules that are to be fired, combining the fired rules, from the control actions. </p>
                                                <br>
                                                <p><strong>4. Defuzzification Module:</strong>The objective of this step is to convert the <strong>single fuzzy set</strong> into a crisp value. As there are various methods of defuzzification, the one best suited is used with specific <strong>expert systems</strong> to reduce the error.</p>


                                                <h3 class="mt-5">Importance of Membership Function in Fuzzy Logic:   </h3>
                                                <p>Membership functions (MFs) are the building blocks of the Fuzzy Set Theory (used in <strong>the fuzzy logic controller</strong> ) and play a vital role in the overall performance of fuzzy representation. It helps characterize the fuzziness described by the fuzzy logic as well as represents the <strong>degrees of truth</strong> in the fuzzy logic. </p>
                                                <br>
                                                <p>Moreover, it is a graph that defines how each point in the input space is mapped to membership value between 0 and 1. The main objective of Membership Functions is to map the non-fuzzy input values to fuzzy linguistic terms, vice versa. There are various types of membership functions like:  </p>
                                                <br>
                                                <br>
                                                <ul>
                                                    <li>Singleton Fuzzy Logic System.</li>
                                                    <li>Gaussian Fuzzifier.</li>
                                                    <li>Trapezoidal.</li>
                                                    <li>Triangular Fuzzifier.</li>
                                                </ul>
                                                <br>
                                                <p>These are the widely used fuzzifiers that are known for their simplicity and lower computational requirements, yet they are not always suitable. Hence, other methods like the <strong>non-singleton fuzzy logic system</strong> are used to account for uncertainty in the data. </p>


                                                <h3 class="mt-5">Applications of Fuzzy Logic System:    </h3>
                                                <p>From aerospace and defense to manufacturing, marine, industrial sector, and more, the fuzzy logic system is swiftly being adopted across sectors along with various other branches of Artificial Intelligence, like deep learning, machine learning, etc. Hence, mentioned here are the areas of <strong>Fuzzy Logic applications:</strong></p>
                                                <br>
                                                <p><strong>1. Automotive Systems:</strong> Making use of various technologies, including the Fuzzy Logic System, the automotive industry aims to enhance the quality of the vehicles. It is prominently using them in the following areas: </p>
                                                <br>
                                                <ul>
                                                    <li>Creating trainable fuzzy systems for idle speed control. </li>
                                                    <li>Shift scheduling for an automatic transmission. </li>
                                                    <li>Improving the efficiency of automatic transmission.</li>
                                                    <li>Creating intelligent highway systems. </li>
                                                    <li>Implementing and enhancing traffic control. </li>
                                                </ul>
                                                <br>
                                                <br>
                                                <p><strong>2. Business:</strong> Organizations worldwide are leveraging the benefits of Fuzzy control for the following reasons:</p>
                                                <ul>
                                                    <li>To create effective decision-making support systems.</li>
                                                    <li>Personnel evaluation in large scale organizations. </li>
                                                </ul>
                                                <br>
                                                <br>
                                                <p><strong>3. Finance: </strong>  In the field of finance and banking the fuzzy logic system is playing a key role in: </p>
                                                <ul>
                                                    <li>Fund management.</li>
                                                    <li>Stock market predictions. </li>
                                                    <li>Transfer control. </li>
                                                    <li>Fraud Prevention. </li>
                                                </ul>
                                                <br>
                                                <br>
                                                <p><strong>4. Security:</strong> Fuzzy Logic Systems has had a great impact on security protocols and is rapidly being implemented in the following:</p>
                                                <ul>
                                                    <li>Decision Systems for security training. </li>
                                                    <li>Numerous security applications and products. </li>
                                                </ul>
                                                <br>
                                                <br>
                                                <p><strong>5. Pattern Recognition & Classification:</strong>  This is another major sector that is using Fuzzy Logic System for: </p>
                                                <ul>
                                                    <li>Command analysis. </li>
                                                    <li>Fuzzy image search. </li>
                                                    <li>Speech and handwriting recognition. </li>
                                                    <li>Facial characteristics analysis. </li>
                                                </ul>
                                                <br>
                                                <br>
                                                <p><strong>6. Electronics:</strong> Fuzzy Logic System is being used in the field of electronics to control: </p>
                                                <ul>
                                                    <li>Automatic exposure in the video cameras. </li>
                                                    <li>Air conditioning systems. </li>
                                                    <li>Humidity in rooms. </li>
                                                    <li>Washing machine timing. </li>
                                                </ul>
                                                
                                                

                                                <h3 class="mt-5">Advantages of Fuzzy Logic Systems:</h3>
                                                <p>The numerous advantages offered by Fuzzy Logic Systems are: </p>
                                                <ul>
                                                    <li>It is easy and understandable. </li>
                                                    <li>Works with any input types, be it imprecise, distorted, or noisy input information.</li>
                                                    <li>Efficiently solves complex problems, leveraging its capability to perform human-like reasoning and decision making. </li>
                                                    <li>It helps deal with uncertainties in engineering.  </li>
                                                    <li>The flexibility of fuzzy logic makes it easier to modify FLS by just adding or deleting rules.</li>
                                                </ul>


                                                <h3 class="mt-5">Disadvantages of Fuzzy Logic Systems: </h3>
                                                <p>Though highly beneficial, the fuzzy logic system is not untouched by disadvantages. Therefore, you help you get a thorough understanding of this aspect of Artificial intelligence, listed below are some of its disadvantages. </p>
                                                <ul>
                                                    <li>Lacks a systematic approach to fuzzy system designing.</li>
                                                    <li>Suitable for problems that don’t require high accuracy.</li>
                                                    <li>It is difficult to set exact, fuzzy rules and membership functions. </li>
                                                    <li>Incapable of recognizing machine learning and <strong>neural network</strong> type patterns. </li>
                                                    <li>Cannot learn from past mistakes or failures, as it lacks self-learning ability.</li>
                                                </ul>
												
												<h2 class="h2_heading pt-3">Conclusion: </h2>
												<p>Fuzzy Logic Systems is among the various underlying factors that enable artificial intelligence and machine learning systems to work seamlessly. It helps, both, commercial as well as non-commercial machines and systems to deliver, acceptable reasoning, which is further enhanced with the help of deep learning, AI search algorithms, and other such technologies. </p>
												
											</div>
					
					
										</div>
									
								
								  </div>
									<!-- <div class="pagination p-5">
										<a href="#">&laquo;</a>

									</div> -->
								</div>

			var coll = document.getElementsByClassName("collapsible");
		var i;
		
		
		for (i = 0; i < coll.length; i++) {
				 $('.activeclass').show('active');
		  coll[i].addEventListener("click", function() {
			this.classList.toggle("active");
			var content = this.nextElementSibling;
			if (content.style.display === "block") {
			  content.style.display = "none";
			} else {
			  content.style.display = "block";
			}
		  });
		}

</ul>

<!-- Tutorial Content Starts Here -->
<div class="col-sm-12 col-md-8 col-xl-6 rounded-3 tutorial-content" id="mainContent">
<h1>Artificial Intelligence - Fuzzy Logic Systems</h1>
<hr />
<div id="google-top-ads">
<div class="top-ad-heading">Advertisements</div>
<div style="text-align:center" class="google-top-ads">
<div id="adp_top_ads" style="text-align:center!important;min-height:90px!important"></div>
<script>
     var adPos = document.getElementById('adp_top_ads');

     var ad_id_300 = "75e8929b-e21c-41ad-bca5-5cb2601dc07b";
     var width = window.innerWidth;
     var ad_id = ad_id_720;
     if( width <= 768 ){
        ad_id =  ad_id_300;
     }else if( width <= 1435 ){
        ad_id =  ad_id_650;
     }
     adPos.innerHTML = '<div id="' + ad_id + '" class="_ap_apex_ad"></div>';

						<div class="course-card-body">
							<h4 class="h48"><a href="https://www.tutorialspoint.com/artificial_intelligence_the_future_of_programming/index.asp" title="Artificial Intelligence : The Future Of Programming" class="" data-title="artificial_intelligence_the_future_of_programming" >Artificial Intelligence : The Future Of Programming</a></h4>							
							<p class="videos-details course-list-video">
    15 Lectures 
    <span><i class="fa fa-clock"></i> 54 mins</span>
</p>							<p class="h25"><i class="fa fa-user"></i> <a href="https://www.tutorialspoint.com/profile/mukund_kumar_mishra" >Mukund Kumar Mishra</a></p>
						</div>
						<div class="v-courses-price">
							<div class="btn-width">   
   <a href="https://www.tutorialspoint.com/artificial_intelligence_the_future_of_programming/index.asp" target="_blank">
   <div class="btn-success rounded">More Detail</div>
   </a>
</div>
						</div>
					</div>
					<div class="clear"></div>
				</div>
								
								</div>
			</div>
			
			<div class="clear"></div>
			
		</div>
		<div class="clear"></div>
	</div>
</div>
<div class="clear"></div>
<div class="clearer"></div>
<p>Fuzzy Logic Systems (FLS) produce acceptable but definite output in response to incomplete, ambiguous, distorted, or inaccurate (fuzzy) input.</p>
<h2>What is Fuzzy Logic?</h2>
<p>Fuzzy Logic (FL) is a method of reasoning that resembles human reasoning. The approach of FL imitates the way of decision making in humans that involves all intermediate possibilities between digital values YES and NO.</p>
<p>The conventional logic block that a computer can understand takes precise input and produces a definite output as TRUE or FALSE, which is equivalent to human’s YES or NO.</p>
<p>The inventor of fuzzy logic, Lotfi Zadeh, observed that unlike computers, the human decision making includes a range of possibilities between YES and NO, such as &minus;</p>
<table border="1" align="center">
<tr>
<td>CERTAINLY YES</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>POSSIBLY YES</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>CANNOT SAY</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>POSSIBLY NO</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>CERTAINLY NO</td>
</tr>
</table>
<p>The fuzzy logic works on the levels of possibilities of input to achieve the definite output.</p>
<h3>Implementation</h3>
<ul class="list">
<li><p>It can be implemented in systems with various sizes and capabilities ranging from small micro-controllers to large, networked, workstation-based control systems.</p></li>
<li><p>It can be implemented in hardware, software, or a combination of both.</p></li>
</ul>
<h2>Why Fuzzy Logic?</h2>
<p>Fuzzy logic is useful for commercial and practical purposes.</p>
<ul class="list">
<li>It can control machines and consumer products.</li>
<li>It may not give accurate reasoning, but acceptable reasoning.</li>
<li>Fuzzy logic helps to deal with the uncertainty in engineering.</li>
</ul>
<h2>Fuzzy Logic Systems Architecture</h2>
<p>It has four main parts as shown &minus;</p>
<ul class="list">
<li><p><b>Fuzzification Module</b> &minus; It transforms the system inputs, which are crisp numbers, into fuzzy sets. It splits the input signal into five steps such as &minus;</p></li>
</ul>
<table style="width:50%" align="center" class="table table-bordered">
<tr>
<td style="text-align:center;"><b>LP</b></td>
<td style="text-align:center;">x is Large Positive</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:center;"><b>MP</b></td>
<td style="text-align:center;">x is Medium Positive</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:center;"><b>S</b></td>
<td style="text-align:center;">x is Small</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:center;"><b>MN</b></td>
<td style="text-align:center;">x is Medium Negative</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:center;"><b>LN</b></td>
<td style="text-align:center;">x is Large Negative</td>
</tr>
</table>
<ul class="list">
<li><p><b>Knowledge Base</b> &minus; It stores IF-THEN rules provided by experts.</p></li>
<li><p><b>Inference Engine</b> &minus; It simulates the human reasoning process by making fuzzy inference on the inputs and IF-THEN rules.</p></li>
<li><p><b>Defuzzification Module</b> &minus; It transforms the fuzzy set obtained by the inference engine into a crisp value.</p></li>
</ul>
<img src="/artificial_intelligence/images/fuzzylogic_system.jpg" alt="Fuzzy Logic System"/>
<p>The <b>membership functions work on</b> fuzzy sets of variables.</p>
<h3>Membership Function</h3>
<p>Membership functions allow you to quantify linguistic term and represent a fuzzy set graphically. A <b>membership function</b> for a fuzzy <i>set A</i> on the universe of discourse X is defined as &mu;<sub>A</sub>:X &rarr; [0,1].</p> 
<p>Here, each element of <i>X</i> is mapped to a value between 0 and 1. It is called <b>membership value</b> or <b>degree of membership</b>. It quantifies the degree of membership of the element in <i>X</i> to the fuzzy set <i>A</i>.</p>
<ul class="list">
<li>x axis represents the universe of discourse.</li>
<li>y axis represents the degrees of membership in the [0, 1] interval.</li>
</ul>
<p>There can be multiple membership functions applicable to fuzzify a numerical value. Simple membership functions are used as use of complex functions does not add more precision in the output.</p>
<p>All membership functions for <b>LP, MP, S, MN,</b> and <b>LN</b> are shown as below &minus;</p>
<img src="/artificial_intelligence/images/membership_functions.jpg" alt="FL Membership Functions"/>
<p>The triangular membership function shapes are most common among various other membership function shapes such as trapezoidal, singleton, and Gaussian.</p>
<p>Here, the input to 5-level fuzzifier varies from -10 volts to +10 volts. Hence the corresponding output also changes.</p>
<h2>Example of a Fuzzy Logic System</h2>
<p>Let us consider an air conditioning system with 5-level fuzzy logic system. This system adjusts the temperature of air conditioner by comparing the room temperature and the target temperature value.</p>
<img src="/artificial_intelligence/images/fuzzylogic_ac_system.jpg" alt="Fuzzy Logic AC System" />
<h3>Algorithm</h3>
<ul class="list">
<li>Define linguistic Variables and terms (start)</li> 
<li>Construct membership functions for them. (start)</li> 
<li>Construct knowledge base of rules (start)</li>
<li>Convert crisp data into fuzzy data sets using membership functions. (fuzzification)</li>
<li>Evaluate rules in the rule base. (Inference Engine)</li>
<li>Combine results from each rule. (Inference Engine)</li>
<li>Convert output data into non-fuzzy values. (defuzzification)</li>
</ul>
<h3>Development</h3>
<p><b>Step 1 &minus; Define linguistic variables and terms</b></p>
<p>Linguistic variables are input and output variables in the form of simple words or sentences. For room temperature, cold, warm, hot, etc., are linguistic terms.</p>
<p style="padding-left:25%;">Temperature (t) = {very-cold, cold, warm, very-warm, hot}</p>
<p>Every member of this set is a linguistic term and it can cover some portion of overall temperature values.</p>
<p><b>Step 2 &minus; Construct membership functions for them</b></p>
<p>The membership functions of temperature variable are as shown &minus;</p>
<img src="/artificial_intelligence/images/membership_function_ac.jpg" alt="MF of AC System"/>
<p><b>Step3 &minus; Construct knowledge base rules</b></p>
<p>Create a matrix of room temperature values versus target temperature values that an air conditioning system is expected to provide.</p>
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr>
<th style="text-align:center;width:20%;vertical-align:middle;">RoomTemp. /Target</th>
<th style="text-align:center;width:20%;vertical-align:middle;">Very_Cold</th>
<th style="text-align:center;width:20%;vertical-align:middle;">Cold</th>
<th style="text-align:center;width:20%;vertical-align:middle;">Warm</th>
<th style="text-align:center;vertical-align:middle;">Hot</th>
<th style="text-align:center;vertical-align:middle;">Very_Hot</th>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Very_Cold</td>
<td>No_Change</td>
<td>Heat</td>
<td>Heat</td>
<td>Heat</td>
<td>Heat</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Cold</td>
<td>Cool</td>
<td>No_Change</td>
<td>Heat</td>
<td>Heat</td>
<td>Heat</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Warm</td>
<td>Cool</td>
<td>Cool</td>
<td>No_Change</td>
<td>Heat</td>
<td>Heat</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Hot</td>
<td>Cool</td>
<td>Cool</td>
<td>Cool</td>
<td>No_Change</td>
<td>Heat</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Very_Hot</td>
<td>Cool</td>
<td>Cool</td>
<td>Cool</td>
<td>Cool</td>
<td>No_Change</td>
</tr>
</table>
<p>Build a set of rules into the knowledge base in the form of IF-THEN-ELSE structures.</p>
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr>
<th style="text-align:center;width:15%;">Sr. No.</th>
<th style="text-align:center;width:70%;">Condition</th>
<th style="text-align:center;width:70%;">Action</th>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:center;vertical-align:middle;">1</td>
<td>IF temperature=(Cold OR Very_Cold) AND target=Warm THEN</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">Heat</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:center;vertical-align:middle;">2</td>
<td>IF temperature=(Hot OR Very_Hot) AND target=Warm THEN</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">Cool</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:center;vertical-align:middle;">3</td>
<td>IF (temperature=Warm) AND (target=Warm) THEN</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">No_Change</td>
</tr>
</table>
<p><b>Step 4 &minus; Obtain fuzzy value</b></p>
<p>Fuzzy set operations perform evaluation of rules. The operations used for OR and AND are Max and Min respectively. Combine all results of evaluation to form a final result. This result is a fuzzy value.</p>
<p><b>Step 5 &minus; Perform defuzzification</b></p>
<p>Defuzzification is then performed according to membership function for output variable.</p>
<img src="/artificial_intelligence/images/defuzzified_value.jpg" alt="DeFuzzied Value" />
<h2>Application Areas of Fuzzy Logic</h2>
<p>The key application areas of fuzzy logic are as given &minus;</p>
<p><b>Automotive Systems</b></p>
<ul class="list">
<li>Automatic Gearboxes</li>
<li>Four-Wheel Steering</li>
<li>Vehicle environment control</li>
</ul>
<p><b>Consumer Electronic Goods</b></p>
<ul class="list">
<li>Hi-Fi Systems</li>
<li>Photocopiers</li>
<li>Still and Video Cameras</li>
<li>Television</li>
</ul>
<p><b>Domestic Goods</b></p>
<ul class="list">
<li>Microwave Ovens</li>
<li>Refrigerators</li>
<li>Toasters</li>
<li>Vacuum Cleaners</li>
<li>Washing Machines</li>
</ul>
<p><b>Environment Control</b></p>
<ul class="list">
<li>Air Conditioners/Dryers/Heaters</li>
<li>Humidifiers</li>
</ul>
<h2>Advantages of FLSs</h2>
<ul class="list">
<li><p>Mathematical concepts within fuzzy reasoning are very simple.</p></li>
<li><p>You can modify a FLS by just adding or deleting rules due to flexibility of fuzzy logic.</p></li>
<li><p>Fuzzy logic Systems can take imprecise, distorted, noisy input information.</p></li>
<li><p>FLSs are easy to construct and understand.</p></li>
<li><p>Fuzzy logic is a solution to complex problems in all fields of life, including medicine, as it resembles human reasoning and decision making.</p></li>
</ul> 
<h2>Disadvantages of FLSs</h2>
<ul class="list">
<li>There is no systematic approach to fuzzy system designing.</li>
<li>They are understandable only when simple.</li>
<li>They are suitable for the problems which do not need high accuracy.</li>
</ul> 
<div class="d-flex justify-content-between border-bottom border-top py-2" id="bottom_navigation">

</div>

					<script>
						if( window.innerWidth > 768 ){
						   var adpushup = adpushup || {};
						   adpushup.que = adpushup.que || [];
						   adpushup.que.push(function() {
						   adpushup.triggerAd("8f8814c2-d64c-4d26-9cb9-543653c0b48f");
						   });
						}
					</script>
				</div>
			</div>
			<!-- Right Column Ends Here -->
		</div>
	</div>
</div>
</div>
</main>
